caption: The restaurant is well known for pink color and it’s a tourist spot for pictures so do expect to see many people outside. It’s quite charming with cozy atmosphere.  We find that the food was fine but if you expect that you gonna say wow from your first bite then this might not be a place for you. The best dish from what we ordered was the meatball, very soft, tasteful and we would recommend it. We don’t remember the name of another main dish, unfortunately we find that it is quite chewy for us.  We were seated on upper floor with beautiful decoration. You might feel it might be a bit cramped  when all seats are occupied. There is only one staff took care all the table on our floor. She is really friendly, attentive and we really satisfied with the service she offered.

Lots of tourists flocking outside to take pictures of the restaurant. Not sure what’s so special about plants growing outside the building. Went to check the menu and seems attractive. Asked the host if I need to reserve a table. Was told they are kinda fully booked but able to sit me in when kitchen opened. Was tired walking around the area and decided to just get sit in for a drink while waiting for the kitchen to open. Well, the restaurant was far from fully booked 😂 guess the host trying to create a demand. Lol. Anyway, ordered a veal dish as main and a carrot cake for dessert. Veal was well cooked and goes well with the gravy. So does the side potatoes. Would rate it 9/10. As for the carrot cake, maybe a 7/10. Definitely worth a try when you are in the area.
We had great time in this restaurant. The atmosphere was super cozy and we really enjoyed the food here!! Also, the service was quick and fantastic. I’d love to visit here again!

Known for its famous spot atop Montmartre on a corner with spectacular views, the restaurant was equally impressive. The espresso martini was one of the best I’ve ever had! The food was delicious and drinks menu had plenty of choices. The 3 course dinner with appetizer, main and dessert was €37 per person and definitely worth the price. Each meal was such high quality and so tasty.

La Maison Rose is a charming, pastel-pink café located in the heart of Montmartre, Paris. With its distinctive color and picturesque appearance, it has become one of the most iconic spots in the neighborhood. The café has a rich history, once frequented by famous artists such as Pablo Picasso and Amedeo Modigliani during the early 20th century, when Montmartre was the hub of artistic creativity. Originally a small café and later a meeting place for local creatives, La Maison Rose has retained its historic charm and continues to attract visitors from around the world.  The café’s story is deeply intertwined with the artistic bohemia of Montmartre, and its exterior remains an emblem of the area’s vibrant cultural heritage. Today, La Maison Rose serves as a lovely spot to enjoy a coffee or meal while soaking in the artistic history of Montmartre, making it a must-visit for anyone exploring this historic district.

When we were walking down from Sacre Coeur we stumbled across this delightful little restaurant.  The service was great by one of the friendliest waitresses we have encountered during our European adventures.  The wine was excellent as was the pastry.

A place with history and bad food. Isn't worth it at all. 30€ per main dish and a dessert. Veal is 80% fat and 20% eatable meat. Fish is too dry. Tastes like our is cooked in a microwave. You'll hardly find portions smaller than these... Upset with the choice

So much history is attached. The iconic pink building was photographic by every other person. Enjoyed a nice dinner outside as we people watched. Waiter was incredibly nice and spoke English very well. We all had the veal which was good but a little fatty for my taste. Dessert was good as well. We traveled a hour and switched few trains to get there. I wouldn't do that again but if you are in the area, it's worth a stop.

The iconic building hosts some of the best warm and flavourful food we have had on our trip to Paris. Tucked into the romantic views of Montmartre, this small restaurant serves up amazing service and a delicious menu that did not disappoint. Make sure to make reservations prior and you will not be disappointed.

I am baffled by any negative reviews of the La Maison Rose—as I came to deliver my overwhelmingly positive one! One of the best experiences I have had anywhere. We arrived without a reservation and they were able to seat us (the place is small so had I thought through things, I would have made a reservation). The atmosphere inside is divine. So much thought in the design and appearance—even more beautiful than the outside if you can imagine it! The food was some of the best we had in Paris (which is saying a lot!). The vegetables were fresh, the drinks were delicious and had fresh flower petals (I recommend the Gertrude!). There were even options for people with dietary restrictions. The service on top of it was fantastic—genuine warmth from the wait staff and the owner came and chatted with us about the history of the restaurant and her love of seasonal food. We lingered and never felt rushed. There are strangely so many people outside taking photos (presumably for Instagram?), but I wish they would all just come inside to eat.

I recently dined at La Maison Rose in Paris and had a pleasant experience. I ordered the meatballs and hummus, which were tasty and satisfying. The staff were friendly and attentive, adding to the overall positive atmosphere of the restaurant. The charming ambiance of the place added to the dining experience. I would recommend La Maison Rose for a casual and enjoyable meal in Paris.

I would give this place zero stars for the food if I could. The bread tasted like it was days old from the grocery store. The focaccia was stale and dry. The fish dish tasted like it was previously frozen. The meatballs were hard as rocks and impossible to cut. While the place is cute, the food is absolutely overpriced and disgusting. Inedible.  The photo shown is what we left without eating.
It is a nice and small cozy place to dine in. And the food is good but small portions compared to the price.
Obviously, this is an iconic spot in Paris as many people come to take photos. The restaurant is cozy, but the food and service were average.

Me, my wife and our 4 years old , we had the 2 course dinner. The hummus appetizer was delicious but very small parti on to share. My wife ordered cod fish. It was overall. But my dish (lamb) was super delicious. But it is kind of pricy for small portion foods. Don’t expect to leave the restaurant full stomach. It is just an experience.

We only had cappuccinos. The waiter was friendly and quick with our order. During my interaction with the other members of the staff, they came across as cordial, but seemed rather cold and not friendly like our waiter had been.

Found out about this lovely restaurant while watching Emily in Paris. Instagrammable exterior and cosy interior. If anyone wants to visit, it’s definitely highly recommended to make a reservation before heading down. The restaurant is quite small and can sit maybe 15-18 people. The restaurant serves delectable food and desserts. Won’t regret visiting there.

Tonight's dinner was not so good. While I was ordering and eating, the waitress was talking too loudly with the customer, which made me uncomfortable throughout the meal. In a small restaurant with only 4 tables, the waitress was talking too loudly, which made me upset throughout the meal. And the food was not fresh. After eating the food from this restaurant, I had to vomit all night.
I’ve been wanting to come here for a long time.  I was able to get in quickly and sat upstairs with a window view. Small , charming and peaceful

Solid apps and great drinks. We stopped here before going to a show and it was a perfect starting spot. Didn’t get a full meal, so no opinion on that, but we enjoyed the atmosphere, staff, smaller bites and drinks!!  Instagram Usually the devil (ed eggs) wears Prada…. 🥚🍞🥩🍖🧀  📸  House made focaccia, fresh goat cheese and ’Nduja from Calabria 📸  Plate of mixed charcuterie from Maison Montalet 📸  Deviled eggs La Maison Rose  @lamaisonroseofficial A creative and welcoming neighborhood table, La Maison Rose offers a short menu based on fresh seasonal products, inspired by French farm to table cuisine and Italian cucina povera.  📍Paris 🇫🇷
It was a nice place and location. There were a bit of small flies which was a bit annoying, and the food was good but I didn’t as expecting a bit more. Location is a wow

Ran by what appeared to be a husband, wife and it looked like their teenage daughter was the only other one working there. The food was good but not spectacular, our order was inaccurate but when we tried to tell them that the daughter just seemed confused so we just let it go. It wasn't a very welcoming feeling dining here. The building was a neat historic location and the wine was excellent. I would eat here again and see if maybe it was just an off night and take into account the daughter did seem to be a teenage and well enough said 😄

We had an incredible couple of days. Hotel is in a great spot to experience Paris. Staff are wonderful. A special mention of Beryl on reception who could not have been more friendly or helpful. We would love to visit again

Wonderful restaurant! It's popular but the vibe inside is cozy, relaxed and calm. We had a full dinner menu and drinks and loved the food! The service was on point, the staff friendly & efficient. Might be a good idea to reserve a table, we were lucky and got one spontaneously.  Tip: Try the Pavlova! It was incredibly tasty <3

We were blown away by the food and service. We turned up earlier than our booking and they were very kind about it. Timothee served us with patience, knowledge and expertise. The food was delicious and the desserts were out of this world. Overall, it was one of the best experiences we’ve had. Thank you!
Good food, good atmosphere, very nice and funny waiter! I loved having dinner here, it is a cute french restaurant and the experience is worth it

We were a walk in when the place opened at 11.30am and luckily we managed to get a table as the first ones in.  We ordered the set menu which was well catered to vegetarians.  The set menu consisted of a hot drink (tea/coffee etc), glass of wine/prosecco, granola with yogurt and apple sauce, poached egg on brioche with hollandaise sauce and a choice of carrot cake or chocolate cake.  Great value for money and great service.  The food was all delicious.

Excellent traditional French cuisine. It had a very intimate and warm atmosphere. The waiting staff were accommodating although we were an hour late to our reservation. The food was great, just the portion sizes were small. I will be visiting again, would highly recommend

Some of the reviews we had seen of this place had mentioned it being overrated, but we found it fantastic. This quaint restaurant is so cute and the service was great. I have celiac disease and the restaurant was great with having an allergen guide for the meal. Everything in the photos except for the bread was gluten free! We ordered the mayo eggs, the veal and potatoes, and the pavlova for dessert. Our meal was one of the best we had in Paris and it was so reasonably priced as well.

You’re cold on the last day of the year in a half sunny Paris. You enter La Maison Rose expecting some touristy trap, especially since you have no reservation. The nice waiter tells you they can sit your party and suddenly you find yourself in a nice cozy room with windows overlooking the beautiful streets of Montmartre. A nice waiter with a big smile comes to explain the menu. He takes the order, leaves and shortly comes back with warm cozy drinks. Suddenly, there is a big strange noise and everyone is looking at a man at the table behind you who just fainted. There is yelling and shouting for help, and you feel nervous and completely useless. Some minutes pass and the man is OK while the waiters surrounding him ask him health related questions while on the phone with a health professional. The waiter with the big smile comes back to every table being as professional as he could ever be, and you feel like being on a plane after some heavy turbulence. Things go back to normal and you enjoy a lovely brunch with delicious food and cake. Simply put, a wonderful start to the last day of the year 2023.

A very small and quaint restaurant. The service itself was average, nothing to brag about. The service still gets 4 stars however because they were extremely flexible and made an effort to seat us right away spontaneously. Especially since the restaurant has less than 15 seats. The food was lovely and the desserts are utterly amazing. I would definitely visit again.

La Maison Rose is such a charming and cozy spot! The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, making it the perfect place for a relaxed meal. The food is delicious, and the staff are incredibly friendly, adding to the overall lovely experience. They don’t have many tables, so it’s best to come early or make a reservation to avoid waiting. Definitely a must-visit for anyone looking for a quaint and delicious dining experience!
making it a relaxing place to sit and enjoy a coffee or a meal. Its historical charm and vibrant atmosphere make La Maison Rose a must-visit for anyone exploring the artistic district of Montmartre.

Cozy place with amazing food. Some of the reviews made me worried about eating there, but I think a lot has to do with language barriers, and different cultures. The owner was very kind. They really care about your experience and the quality of the food. We had no trouble making a reservation, and all the dinner options sounded amazing. We went for our 20th anniversary and it didn’t disappoint! No pics of our food or inside, I respect their decision for that! Makes the time dining better.

The place was very cute. The personnel were very accomodating and kind. The attending personnel explained the menu carefully. The waiting time for the order was not that long. We were able to secure a spot for two during dinner time.

We naively showed up with no reservation on our last day in Paris not realizing how busy this restaurant is! By some miracle the waiter was kind enough to find us a seat. We were so grateful for his kindness on a busy day!! This restaurant lives up to its reviews. Not only is it a beautiful building, but the food was the best i had in Paris! Absolutely amazing, I’ve never had such flavourful unique food anywhere else! The staff was sooo friendly and welcoming too. All around a fabulous experience! You have to stop by next time you’re in Paris, but I’d recommend making a reservation!

Such a cute place with vegan options 😍.  Last weekend we had lunch at this cute restaurant in Montmartre and enjoyed it very much. The vegan menu was delicious and quite creative!  On top I found the service very friendly and quick. We really had a great time with them. I will definitely come back with friends ☺️

Wow! What an amazing place! It’s very cute pink building up on a hill. The place is quite small but very cosy and sweet. The food was absolutely amazing. The service was very fast and good even though it was fully packed. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. It was a great experience. It’s located in a touristy area so it’s very busy and expect to see a lot of passers by taking photos. Not too suitable for big groups or families due to being too small and the outdoor seating being on the sidewalk.
